units.title: Ethical approval and tissue collection
units.text: Tissue collection was approved by the medical ethical committee (METC) of the Diako- nessenhuis hospital, in agreement with the declaration of Helsinki and according to Dutch and European Union legislation. The samples were collected under METC protocol 12/093 HUB-Cancer following written informed consent at the Diako- nessenhuis hospital Utrecht.
units.rationale: Describes consent and approval required before obtaining samples.

units.title: Isolation of colonic crypts for organoid generation
units.text: crypts of the healthy portion of the colonic epithelium (at least 10 cm away from the tumor side) were isolated by digestion of the intestinal mucosa in chelation solution (5.6 mM Na2HPO4, 8.0 mM KH2PO4, supplemented with dithiotreitol (0.5 mM, Sigma) and EDTA (2 mM, in-house) for 30 min at 4 °C. Colonic crypts were subsequently plated in basement membrane extract (BME; Cultrex PC BME RGF type 2, Amsbio).
units.rationale: Provides the step to obtain crypts and embed them for organoid culture.

units.title: Composition of human intestinal stem cell medium (HISCM)
units.text: Human intestinal stem cell medium (HISCM), which is composed of Advanced Dulbecco’s modiﬁed Eagle medium/F12 supplemented with penicillin/streptomythan 2‑fold were extremely few at <1%, between two independent cin, 10 mM HEPES and Glutamax (all Gibco, Thermo Fischer Scientiﬁc) with 50% Wnt3a conditioned medium (in‑house), 20% R‑Spondin1 conditioned medium (in‑house), 10% Noggin conditioned medium (in‑house), 1x B27, 1.25mM N‑acetylcysteine, 10 mM nicotinamide, 50 ng/ml human EGF, 10 nM Gastrin, 500 nM A83‑01, 3 µM SB202190, 10 nM prostaglandine E2 and 100 µg/ml Primocin (Invivogen).
units.rationale: Lists the exact formulation used to culture organoids.

units.title: Clonal organoid derivation and FACS sorting
units.text: To generate clonal tumor organoid lines, early passage tumor organoids were dissociated into single cells by TryPLE (Thermo Fischer Scientiﬁc), washed and suspended in FACS buffer (PBS with 2 mM ETDA and 5% FCS). Prior to FACS puriﬁcation, DAPI was added to the FACS buffer. HLA‑A2+ single cells were sorted into separate wells of 96‑well plates containing 100 µl HISCM with 10 µM LY27632 and coated with BME. Sorted cells were then covered with 10 µl BME and placed in the incubator at 37 °C.
units.rationale: Details the dissociation, staining, and single‑cell sorting to obtain clonal lines.

units.title: Organoid harvest
units.text: On the day of harvest, organoids were removed from the 6‑well culture plates using medium and P1000 pipettes and spun down for 8 min at 500 g with the brakes off.
units.rationale: Specifies how organoids are collected prior to downstream processing.

units.title: Cell pellet processing after BME removal
units.text: Cell pellets were then incubated with Cell Recovery Solution (Roche Diagnostics) for 30 min on ice to remove excess BME. Cells liberated from BME were then washed three times in excess PBS to remove any residual BME. After the last wash, all PBS was removed and the tube opening was quickly dried using a paper towel. Cell pellets were snap frozen in dry ice and stored at −80 °C.
units.rationale: Covers the removal of matrix, washing, and storage of cell pellets.

units.title: Organoid lysis and protein extraction
units.text: Organoids were lysed by gentle vortexing in 8 M Urea in 50 mM ammonium bicarbonate supplemented with 50 µg/ml DNAse I (Sigma‑Aldrich), 50 µg/ml RNAse A (Sigma‑Aldrich) and 1× complete EDTA‑free protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche Diagnostics). Subsequently, the lysate was cleared by centrifugation for 1 h at 18,000 g at 15 °C. Protein concentration was determined with the Bradford assay.
units.rationale: Describes lysis conditions and clarification of protein extracts.

units.title: Protein reduction, alkylation and enzymatic digestion
units.text: For each sample, 20 µg of total protein was reduced, alkylated, and digested sequentially with Lys‑C (1:100) and trypsin (1:75).
units.rationale: Outlines the preparation of peptides for mass‑spectrometry.

units.title: High‑pH reversed‑phase peptide fractionation
units.text: For high‑pH reversed‑phase fractionation, peptide digests were loaded on C18 STAGE‑tips in 200 mM ammonium formate at pH 10 and eluted into 5 fractions with 11–80 % acetonitrile.
units.rationale: Provides the step to separate peptides before LC‑MS/MS.

units.title: LC‑MS/MS sample preparation and analysis
units.text: All samples were dried by vacuum centrifugation and reconstituted in 10 % formic acid prior to LC‑MS/MS analyses. Per fraction, three technical replicates were measured by LC‑MS/MS.
units.rationale: Final preparation and measurement of peptide fractions.
